Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2012 02:45PM Tookybum wrote: I am new to this forum.  I found the lump just about 6 weeks ago and will be in for my lumpectomy and sentinal node biopsy on Thursday June 14th.  Everything has moved so quickly.  Funny I am not too worried about the surgery itself.  My surgeon told flat out there is no chance I would wake up without a breast.  She said they just don't do that anymore.  She also said she is very good at what she does and 9 times out of ten she gets a clear margin.  Here's hoping. I am more worried about the after...radiation and chemo. Thanks to everyone sharing their stories.  It helps so much to have some idea what to expect.
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy - what can i expect? Shayne Angelaw69

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2012 02:03PM Tookybum wrote: GirlPowerDebbie; Wow we could be twins.  My tumour was in the same spot 1.6 cm and had 5 nodes out.  All clean thank goodness.  But the incision under my breast healed well with no trouble at all.  The brusing has been moving up my breast and I find my nipple is very sore now.  But my biggest complaint is the incision under my arm.  I am finally off the Tylenol 3's but I still get twinges that make me grab under my arm and apply pressure which seems to helps.  I also use an ice pack at night (especially since we are getting 90 degree days here in Ontario) It seems to bring down swelling that developes during the day.
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy - what can i expect? Shayne Angelaw69
